## Flutter-specific Checks (Developer)

<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->

- [ ] **Flutter Version:** Confirm that the Flutter version being used is up-to-date and compatible with the project.
- [ ] **Null Safety:** Ensure that the codebase follows Flutter's null safety guidelines.
- [ ] **State Management:** Check if the state management approach is used consistently and appropriately.
- [ ] **Widgets Reusability:** Verify that widgets are designed for reusability and are not tightly coupled to specific screens or use cases.
- [ ] **Performance:** Check for potential performance bottlenecks, such as inefficient widget builds or excessive re-renders.
- [ ] **Error Handling:** Ensure proper error handling, especially when dealing with async operations and network requests.
- [ ] **Dependency Management:** Verify that dependencies in pubspec.yaml are up-to-date and used responsibly.
- [ ] **Design Guidelines:** Ensure that the UI conforms to design guidelines and maintains a consistent look and feel.
- [ ] **Responsiveness:** Check that the app UI works well on different screen sizes and orientations.
- [ ] **Localization:** If applicable, verify that the code supports multiple languages and is localized appropriately.
